metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: R Arrays
Arrays
Compared to matrices, arrays can have more than two dimensions.
content.html: Compared to matrices, arrays can have more than two dimensions.

content.text: We can use the array() function to create an array, and the dim parameter to specify the dimensions:
content.html: We can use the array() function to create an array, and the dim parameter to specify the dimensions:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
# An array with one dimension with values ranging from 1 to 24thisarray <- 
  c(1:24)thisarray# An array with more than one dimension
  multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))multiarray
# An array with one dimension with values ranging from 1 to 24
# An array with more than one dimension

content.code:
# An array with one dimension with values ranging from 1 to 24thisarray <-
c(1:24)thisarray# An array with more than one dimension
multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))multiarray

syntax_highlighting.text:
# An array with one dimension with values ranging from 1 to 24thisarray <- 
  c(1:24)thisarray# An array with more than one dimension
  multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))multiarray
# An array with one dimension with values ranging from 1 to 24
# An array with more than one dimension

content.code_html:
# An array with one dimension with values ranging from 1 to 24
thisarray <- c(1:24)
thisarray

# An array with more than one dimension
 multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
multiarray

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
# An array with one dimension with values ranging from 1 to 24thisarray <- 
  c(1:24)thisarray# An array with more than one dimension
  multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))multiarray
# An array with one dimension with values ranging from 1 to 24
# An array with more than one dimension

content.text: Example Explained
In the example above we create an array with the values 1 to 24.
content.html: In the example above we create an array with the values 1 to 24.

content.text: How does dim=c(4,3,2) work? The first and second number in the bracket specifies the amount of rows and columns. The last number in the bracket specifies how many dimensions we want.
content.html:
How does dim=c(4,3,2) work?
The first and second number in the bracket specifies the amount of rows and columns.
The last number in the bracket specifies how many dimensions we want.

content.text: Note: Arrays can only have one data type.
content.html: Note: Arrays can only have one data type.

content.text: Access Array Items
You can access the array elements by referring to the index position. You can use the [] brackets to access the desired elements from an array:
content.html: You can access the array elements by referring to the index position. You can use the [] brackets to access the desired elements from an array:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
thisarray <- c(1:24)multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
  multiarray[2, 3, 2]

content.code:
thisarray <- c(1:24)multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
multiarray[2, 3, 2]

syntax_highlighting.text:
thisarray <- c(1:24)multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
  multiarray[2, 3, 2]

content.code_html:
thisarray <- c(1:24)
multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))

multiarray[2, 3, 2]

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
thisarray <- c(1:24)multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
  multiarray[2, 3, 2]

content.text: The syntax is as follow: array[row position, column position, matrix level]
content.html: The syntax is as follow: array[row position, column position, matrix level]

content.text: You can also access the whole row or column from a matrix in an array, by using the c() function:
content.html: You can also access the whole row or column from a matrix in an array, by using the c() function:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
thisarray <- c(1:24)# Access all the items from the first row from 
  matrix onemultiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
  multiarray[c(1),,1]# Access all the items from the first column 
  from matrix onemultiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
  multiarray[,c(1),1]

# Access all the items from the first row from 
  matrix one

# Access all the items from the first column 
  from matrix one

content.code:
thisarray <- c(1:24)# Access all the items from the first row from
matrix onemultiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
multiarray[c(1),,1]# Access all the items from the first column
from matrix onemultiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
multiarray[,c(1),1]

syntax_highlighting.text:
thisarray <- c(1:24)# Access all the items from the first row from 
  matrix onemultiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
  multiarray[c(1),,1]# Access all the items from the first column 
  from matrix onemultiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
  multiarray[,c(1),1]

# Access all the items from the first row from 
  matrix one

# Access all the items from the first column 
  from matrix one

content.code_html:
thisarray <- c(1:24)

# Access all the items from the first row from matrix one
multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
multiarray[c(1),,1]

# Access all the items from the first column from matrix one
multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
multiarray[,c(1),1]

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
thisarray <- c(1:24)# Access all the items from the first row from 
  matrix onemultiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
  multiarray[c(1),,1]# Access all the items from the first column 
  from matrix onemultiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
  multiarray[,c(1),1]

# Access all the items from the first row from 
  matrix one

# Access all the items from the first column 
  from matrix one

content.text: A comma (,) before c() means that we want to access the column.
content.html: A comma (,) before c() means that we want to access the column.

content.text: A comma (,) after c() means that we want to access the row.
content.html: A comma (,) after c() means that we want to access the row.

content.text: Check if an Item Exists
To find out if a specified item is present in an array, use the %in% operator:
content.html: To find out if a specified item is present in an array, use the %in% operator:

syntaxHighlighting.text: thisarray <- c(1:24)multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))2 %in% multiarray

content.code: thisarray <- c(1:24)multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))2 %in% multiarray

syntax_highlighting.text: thisarray <- c(1:24)multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))2 %in% multiarray

content.code_html:
thisarray <- c(1:24)
multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))

2 %in% multiarray

syntax_highlighting_data.text: thisarray <- c(1:24)multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))2 %in% multiarray

content.text: Amount of Rows and Columns
Use the dim() function to find the amount of rows and columns in an array:
content.html: Use the dim() function to find the amount of rows and columns in an array:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
thisarray <- c(1:24)multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
  dim(multiarray)

content.code:
thisarray <- c(1:24)multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
dim(multiarray)

syntax_highlighting.text:
thisarray <- c(1:24)multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
  dim(multiarray)

content.code_html:
thisarray <- c(1:24)
multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))

dim(multiarray)

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
thisarray <- c(1:24)multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
  dim(multiarray)

content.text: Array Length
Use the length() function to find the dimension of an array:
content.html: Use the length() function to find the dimension of an array:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
thisarray <- c(1:24)multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
  length(multiarray)

content.code:
thisarray <- c(1:24)multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
length(multiarray)

syntax_highlighting.text:
thisarray <- c(1:24)multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
  length(multiarray)

content.code_html:
thisarray <- c(1:24)
multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))

length(multiarray)

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
thisarray <- c(1:24)multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
  length(multiarray)

content.text: Loop Through an Array
You can loop through the array items by using a for loop:
content.html: You can loop through the array items by using a for loop:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
thisarray <- c(1:24)multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
  for(x in multiarray){  print(x)}

content.code:
thisarray <- c(1:24)multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
for(x in multiarray){  print(x)}

syntax_highlighting.text:
thisarray <- c(1:24)multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
 for(x in multiarray){  print(x)}

content.code_html:
thisarray <- c(1:24)
multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))

for(x in multiarray){
  print(x)
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
thisarray <- c(1:24)multiarray <- array(thisarray, dim = c(4, 3, 2))
  for(x in multiarray){  print(x)}
